articles.title: Sleep's Role in Early Childhood Development

content.headline: How Sleep Powers Early Development
content.intro: Adequate, quality sleep is fundamental to children's growth, learning, and overall development. During sleep, critical processes occur that support physical growth, brain development, and emotional regulation throughout early childhood.

sections.title: Developmental Benefits of Quality Sleep
sections.content: Sleep supports multiple aspects of child development:
points: Brain development: Neural connections strengthen during sleep
Memory consolidation: Learning from the day gets processed and stored
Physical growth: Growth hormone is primarily released during deep sleep
Immune function: Sleep supports immune system development and function
Emotional regulation: Well-rested children manage emotions better
Attention and learning: Adequate sleep improves focus and information processing

sections.title: Age-Appropriate Sleep Requirements
sections.content: Ensure children get sufficient sleep for their developmental stage:
points: Consistent bedtimes are as important as total sleep duration

sections.title: Signs of Healthy Sleep Patterns
points: Falls asleep within 15-30 minutes of going to bed
Stays asleep through the night with minimal awakenings
Wakes up feeling refreshed and energetic
Maintains consistent sleep and wake times
Demonstrates good mood and alertness during waking hours
